docs.snippet: ''60 Minutes'' has landed the first post-election interview of President-elect Barack Obama and his wife, Michelle. for this Sunday.     CBS News announced Thursday that the Obamas would sit down Friday in Chicago to speak with the ''60 Minutes'' ...
docs.lead_paragraph: ''60 Minutes'' has landed the first post-election interview of President-elect Barack Obama and his wife, Michelle. for this Sunday. CBS News announced Thursday that the Obamas would sit down Friday in Chicago to speak with the ''60 Minutes'' correspondent Steve Kroft. The interview is expected to fill more than one segment on the broadcast. It may fill the entire hour.
docs.abstract: CBS News announces that 60 Minutes has landed first post-election interview with Pres-elect Obama and his wife Michelle; interview is expected to fill more than one segment on broadcast and may fill entire hour (M)

docs.snippet: The nation's governors don't want people in their states to lose health coverage under a repeal of the Obama-era health care law, but even after a weekend of bipartisan meetings, they still don't agree on the best approach to replace it....
docs.lead_paragraph: The nation's governors don't want people in their states to lose health coverage under a repeal of the Obama-era health care law, but even after a weekend of bipartisan meetings, they still don't agree on the best approach to replace it.

headline.main: Plan to Repeal Obama Health Law Shows GOP Governors Are Torn

docs.snippet: The first lady has been opening up about her own struggles and the “insults and slights” that even living in the White House has not protected her family from....
docs.lead_paragraph: The first lady has been opening up about her own struggles and the “insults and slights” that even living in the White House has not protected her family from.
docs.abstract: First Lady Michelle Obama shares her own experiences and struggles with race and achievement in string of commencement speeches, adding her voice to national dialogue on subject; Obama has used her life story to try and inspire young people, particularly African-Americans, and confesses that even as first lady she has had to contend with questions and speculation rooted in fear or misperception.

headline.main: Michelle Obama Talks About Race and Success, and Makes It Personal
headline.print_headline: First Lady Opens Up About Race and Success
